subject: RE: [junit] Can I create a dynamic JUnit ?  (in Cactus Framework)
msgSnippet: ... Donny Widjaja ... This is by design in JUnit:  your test objects are reinstantiated from scratch before every test method, which makes it hard to maintain
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Donny Widjaja

> When I debug my code, I saw that JUnit calls my constructor,
> and added the object into the suite. However, when it runs
> the test case, it try to re-create the object again by
> calling generic constructor with no-args or one arguments.

This is by design in JUnit: your test objects are reinstantiated from
scratch before every test method, which makes it hard to maintain state
between method invocations.

Another problem is that JUnit test methods can't accept parameters, and I
suspect that it's really what you are trying to achieve (passing these
parameters in the constructor is the usual way to work around this
limitation).

Since these are two design decisions I didn't like in JUnit, I implemented
them differently in TestNG, which:

- Doesn't reinstantiate your test object between each test invocation
- Lets you pass parameters to test methods (and you specify the values for
these parameters either in XML or programmatically)
